t: Psalm 88
A Cry of Desperation
A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah. For the choir director: according to Mahalath Leannoth. A Maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
Lord,*spn God of my salvation, I*ln cry out before you day and night.
May*ln my prayer reach your presence; listen*ln to my cry.
For*pn I have had enough troubles, and*ln my life is near Sheol.
I*ln am counted among those going down to the Pit. I*ln am like a man without strength,
abandoned*ln among the dead. I*ln am like the slain lying in the grave, whom*ln you no longer remember, and*ln who are cut off from your care.
You*pn have put me in the lowest part of the Pit, in*ln the darkest places, in the depths.
Your*ln wrath weighs heavily on me; you*ln have overwhelmed me with all your waves. Selah*ig
You*ln have distanced my friends from me; you*ln have made me repulsive to them. I*ln am shut in and cannot go out.
My*ln eyes are worn out from crying. Lord,*sln I cry out to you all day long; I*ln spread out my hands to you.
Do*pn you work wonders for the dead? Do*ln departed spirits rise up to praise you? Selah*ig
Will*ln your faithful love be declared in the grave, your*ln faithfulness in Abaddon?
Will*ln your wonders be known in the darkness or*ln your righteousness in the land of oblivion?
But*pn I call to you for help, Lord;*s in*ln the morning my prayer meets you.
Lord,*sln why do you reject me? Why*ln do you hide your face from me?
From*ln my youth, I*ln have been suffering and near death. I*ln suffer your horrors; I am desperate.
Your*ln wrath sweeps over me; your*ln terrors destroy me.
They*ln surround me like water all day long; they*ln close in on me from every side.
You*ln have distanced loved one and neighbor from me; darkness*ln is my only friend.
